job_title: MERN full stack developer *Fully Remote* | You must have a passion for Cinema
job_description: Job descriptionRight now, we’re looking for a senior developer with experience leading teams and collaborating closely with product owners.In this role, you’ll be joining our team as a senior developer who’s eager to practice Value Engineering while solving tough challenges. Responsibilities will include:• Helping us to scope and estimate development work on client projects• Drafting technical architecture p...lans for implementation• Communicating directly with clients to align project scope with budget and timeline• Owning the success of the project with a close eye on team velocity, project scope, budget, and timeline• Supporting more junior team members through code review and advising• Contributing to projects as an individual contributor and leadThe person we’re looking for is happy, relaxed and easy to get along with. They’re flexible on anything except conceits that will lower their usually outstanding work quality. They work “smart”, by carefully managing their workflow and staggering features that have dependencies intelligently — they prefer deep work but are OK coming up to the surface now and then for top level / strategic conversations.We believe people with backgrounds or interests in design, art, music, food or fashion tend to have a well rounded sense of design & quality — so a variety of hobbies or side projects is a big nice to have!Must Have Competencies:• Extensive backend experience with Ruby on Rails, Elixir Phoenix, or Node.js Frameworks• Experience with JavaScript frameworks (React + Next.js, Vue, or Svelte) and a love of Typescript• Fluency in SQL & database operations, and experience with one of PostgreSQL, MongoDB, MySQL or SQLite.• Fluency in HTTP, Status Codes, Security Standards and other Web protocols & patterns.• Extensive experience with API Design and knowledge of REST and GraphQL, as well as authentication strategies with JWTs and OAuth 2.0.• Experience with AWS, GCP, or Azure and a core understanding of best practices such as IAM & credential management.• Production experience with PaaS providers such as Heroku, Render, Cloud66, Vercel, or Gigalixir.Read more here: https://garden3d.notion.site/Senior-Full-stack-Developer-de17f758bfe74a9ea7929b0006fab7fc

Job highlightsIdentified by Google from the original job postQualificationsWe are looking for additional "right fit" remote, early, possibly founding team member that is a highly entrepreneurial spirited and motivatedYou must be proficient with React as well as React Native Node.js, FirebaseYou must be looking for the freedom and the challenge of a startup lifeYou MUST be contactable and able to work with others during the course of each week on PST/EST times zonesYou must be able to attend a weekly team Zoom every Saturday 9AM PSTYou must be able to deliver something new to test each weekLike working in an environment that prioritizes action over waiting for permissionYou want to be part of a team that's revolutionizing the cinema experience for the futureExcellent working experience of React Native, React, Node.js & Firebase6 more items(s)BenefitsQualified candidates will be compensated with a share of the company "equity currency" depending on the amount of time he or she can commit to the projectResponsibilitiesMovies, moviegoing, and all things cinematic are your passionThis will be followed by full time "combination of salaried/equity" position post-seed fundingMore job highlightsJob descriptionIMPORTANT READ FULL AD BEFORE APPLYINGThis position is ( Paid In Equity ) until we are funded.Try out what's upcoming for our mobile app by making an account via our public facing pre-release "web app" (cinemaloop.app). Please do this from your desktop machine (set location to LA) as this is a location based product. We'll ask your thoughts on the product if we interview with you.-----------...-----------------------------------ABOUT USWe are very close to launch a Beta test in Los Angeles, but we need your help to push this product over the finishline.Cinemaloop Inc. is an awesome group of cinema-lovers, movie-buffs, film nerds, cine-socialities and cinephiles and we?re on a mission to design new innovative platform for the moviegoing-loving generations. We are a soft-tech company that champions inclusion and connections among diverse movie fans.You can find out more about the product vision here: cinemaloop.coABOUT THE POSITION:We are looking for additional "right fit" remote, early, possibly founding team member that is a highly entrepreneurial spirited and motivated. You must be proficient with React as well as React Native Node.js, Firebase. You must be looking for the freedom and the challenge of a startup life.You must be:? You MUST be contactable and able to work with others during the course of each week on PST/EST times zones.? You must be able to attend a weekly team Zoom every Saturday 9AM PST.? You must be able to deliver something new to test each week.You are a culture fit if you:? Want to make this product for yourself!? Live and breathe film? - Movies, moviegoing, and all things cinematic are your passion.? Like working in an environment that prioritizes action over waiting for permission.? Dream of changing the world? - You want to be part of a team that's revolutionizing the cinema experience for the future.This is a "part-time" and "equity currency-based" positionEquity 0.5% - 1% = (in Common Shares 100,000,000 - 200,000,000). Qualified candidates will be compensated with a share of the company "equity currency" depending on the amount of time he or she can commit to the project. This will be followed by full time "combination of salaried/equity" position post-seed funding.YOUR EXPERIENCE /SKILLS:? Excellent working experience of React Native, React, Node.js & FirebaseApply Job!For more such jobs please click here!

Job highlightsIdentified by Google from the original job postQualificationsBachelor’s degree in computer science or the equivalent combination of education, training, or work experience5+ years of experience with design, development, deployment, and management of secure, highly scalable production-grade platformsExperience writing production grade software applications using the following:Back-end using AWS C#/.NetBoth SQL, NoSQL databases using PostgreSQL, MongoDBExperience building applications using AWS cloud native servicesWorking with CI/CD pipelines and tools (e.g., Jenkins, GitHub Actions)Ability to understand business requirements and translate them into technical requirementsStrong experience with containerization and orchestration tools like Docker and KubernetesExperience with CI/CD tools like Jenkins, GitLab CI, CircleCI, or similar7 more items(s)BenefitsWorldpay Perks - What We’ll Bring For YouThat’s why we offer global benefits and programs to support you at every stageA competitive salary and benefitsTime to support charities and give back to your communityParental leave policyGlobal recognition platformVirgin Pulse accessGlobal employee assistance programThe pay range for this full-time position is $105,070.00 - $176,520.00 and reflects the minimum and maximum target for new hire salaries for this position based on the posted role, level, and locationWithin the range, actual individual starting pay is determined by additional factors, including job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or trainingAny changes in work location will also impact actual individual starting pay8 more items(s)ResponsibilitiesAs a Software Engineer you could work with bleeding edge technology as you build innovative fintech products that change the way the world pays, banks and investsThis will involve developing core versions of software applications, identifying client requirements and technical specifications, interacting with engineering groups and training clients on applicationsWork effectively in Agile development teamsWrite unit/integration tests and functional automationDevelop high quality, well documented, and efficient code Experience with microservices and API first platforms3 more items(s)More job highlightsJob descriptionJob DescriptionAre you ready to write your next chapter?Make your mark at one of the biggest names in payments. With proven technology, we process the largest volume of payments in the world, driving the global economy every day. When you join Worldpay, you join a global community of experts and changemakers, working to reinvent an industry by constantly evolving how we work and making the way... millions of people pay easier, every day.What makes a Worldpayer? It’s simple: Think, Act, Win. We stay curious, always asking the right questions to be better every day, finding creative solutions to simplify the complex. We’re dynamic, every Worldpayer is empowered to make the right decisions for their customers. And we’re determined, always staying open – winning and failing as one.About The RoleAs a Software Engineer you could work with bleeding edge technology as you build innovative fintech products that change the way the world pays, banks and invests. This will involve developing core versions of software applications, identifying client requirements and technical specifications, interacting with engineering groups and training clients on applications.What You BringBachelor’s degree in computer science or the equivalent combination of education, training, or work experience.• 5+ years of experience with design, development, deployment, and management of secure, highly scalable production-grade platforms• Experience writing production grade software applications using the following:Back-end using AWS C#/.NetBoth SQL, NoSQL databases using PostgreSQL, MongoDB• Work effectively in Agile development teams.• Write unit/integration tests and functional automation.• Develop high quality, well documented, and efficient code .• Experience with microservices and API first platforms.• Experience building applications using AWS cloud native services.• Working with CI/CD pipelines and tools (e.g., Jenkins, GitHub Actions).• Ability to understand business requirements and translate them into technical requirements.• Strong experience with containerization and orchestration tools like Docker and Kubernetes• Experience with CI/CD tools like Jenkins, GitLab CI, CircleCI, or similar.Worldpay Perks - What We’ll Bring For YouWe know it’s bigger than just your career. It’s your life, and your world. That’s why we offer global benefits and programs to support you at every stage. Here’s a taste of what you can expect.• A competitive salary and benefits.• Time to support charities and give back to your community.• Parental leave policy.• Global recognition platform.• Virgin Pulse access.• Global employee assistance program.Apply now to write the next chapter in your career. We can’t wait to hear from you.To find out more about working with us, find us on LinkedIn.Worldpay is committed to providing its employees with an exciting career opportunity and competitive compensation. The pay range for this full-time position is $105,070.00 - $176,520.00 and reflects the minimum and maximum target for new hire salaries for this position based on the posted role, level, and location. Within the range, actual individual starting pay is determined by additional factors, including job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training. Any changes in work location will also impact actual individual starting pay. Please consult with your recruiter about the specific salary range for your preferred location during the hiring process.Privacy StatementWorldpay is committed to protecting the privacy and security of all personal information that we process in order to provide services to our clients. For specific information on how Worldpay protects personal information online, please see the Online Privacy Notice.EEOC StatementWorldpay is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, genetic information, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other protected characteristics. The EEO is the Law poster is available here supplement document available here.For positions located in the US, the following conditions apply. If you are made a conditional offer of employment, you will be required to undergo a drug test. ADA Disclaimer: In developing this job description care was taken to include all competencies needed to successfully perform in this position. However, for Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) purposes, the essential functions of the job may or may not have been described for purposes of ADA reasonable accommodation. All reasonable accommodation requests will be reviewed and evaluated on a case-by-case basis.Sourcing ModelRecruitment at Worldpay works primarily on a direct sourcing model; a relatively small portion of our hiring is through recruitment agencies. Worldpay does not accept resumes from recruitment agencies which are not on the preferred supplier list and is not responsible for any related fees for resumes submitted to job postings, our employees, or any other part of our company.

Job highlightsIdentified by Google from the original job postQualifications✅ Word & PDF Export: Generate formatted legal & real estate documents🔹 Frontend: React.js (Next.js), Tailwind CSS, Redux🔹 File Storage: AWS S3 or Google Cloud Storage✔️ 5+ years experience in full-stack development✔️ Strong in Python (FastAPI) or Node.js (NestJS/Express)✔️ Experience with AI APIs (OpenAI, OCR, NLP tools)✔️ Skilled in React.js (Next.js), Tailwind CSS, Redux✔️ Familiar with AWS/GCP hosting, serverless architecture✔️ Understands document processing, PDF/DOCX handling✔️ Ability to design scalable and modular APIs✔️ Bonus: Experience with legal tech or real estate software8 more items(s)ResponsibilitiesThe core system will extract key clauses, deadlines, and obligations from legal and real estate documents, then generate structured, jurisdiction-compliant outputsWe need an experienced Full-Stack Developer to develop the backend API, user dashboard, and document processing workflowsThis project will start with an MVP and has a clear roadmap for expansion, making scalability a key priority✅ Automated Document Generation: Create structured legal & real estate outputs🔹 Backend: FastAPI (Python), PostgreSQL, AWS/GCP2 more items(s)More job highlightsJob descriptionProject Overview:We are building an AI-powered platform that automates legal drafting for litigation support and separately but using much of the same resources, contract review for real estate agents. The core system will extract key clauses, deadlines, and obligations from legal and real estate documents, then generate structured, jurisdiction-compliant outputs.We need an experienced Full-St...ack Developer to develop the backend API, user dashboard, and document processing workflows. This project will start with an MVP and has a clear roadmap for expansion, making scalability a key priority.Project Scope & Requirements🔹 Core Features for MVP:✅ Web-Based Platform: Upload legal/real estate contracts (PDF, DOCX)✅ AI-Powered Data Extraction: Identify key dates, clauses, and obligations✅ Automated Document Generation: Create structured legal & real estate outputs✅ Task & Deadline Automation: Sync key dates with Google Calendar/Outlook✅ User Authentication & Multi-Tenant Access: Different user roles (lawyers, agents)✅ Word & PDF Export: Generate formatted legal & real estate documents🔹 Tech Stack (Preferred, Open to Suggestions):🔹 Backend: FastAPI (Python), PostgreSQL, AWS/GCP🔹 AI Integration: OpenAI GPT-4-turbo, Google Vision API (OCR), LangChain (optional)🔹 Frontend: React.js (Next.js), Tailwind CSS, Redux🔹 File Storage: AWS S3 or Google Cloud Storage🔹 Task & Notification System: Celery + Redis🔹 Authentication: Firebase Auth / Auth0Ideal Candidate:✔️ 5+ years experience in full-stack development✔️ Strong in Python (FastAPI) or Node.js (NestJS/Express)✔️ Experience with AI APIs (OpenAI, OCR, NLP tools)✔️ Skilled in React.js (Next.js), Tailwind CSS, Redux✔️ Familiar with AWS/GCP hosting, serverless architecture✔️ Understands document processing, PDF/DOCX handling✔️ Ability to design scalable and modular APIs✔️ Bonus: Experience with legal tech or real estate software

job_title: Sr. Full Stack Developer Remote / Telecommute Jobs
job_description: Job highlightsIdentified by Google from the original job postQualificationsRemote Full Stack Developer Requirements:Proven experience as a Full Stack Developer or similar roleProven experience developing desktop and mobile applicationsFamiliarity with common stacksKnowledge of multiple front-end languages and libraries (such as HTML/ CSS, JavaScript, XML, jQuery, etc. etc.)Knowledge of multiple back-end languages (such as C#, Java, Python, etc. etc.) and JavaScript frameworks (such as Angular, React, Node.js, etc. etc.)Familiarity with databases (e.g. MySQL, MongoDB), web servers (e.g. Apache) and UI/UX designExcellent communication and teamwork skills - you must respond to clients within a business day!How to Apply to Be a FreeUp Freelancer6 more items(s)BenefitsDaily Full Stack Developer job opportunitiesSet your own hourly full stack developer freelance rates (or fixed-rate projects)Set your own work from home scheduleWork and earn as much as you want as a full stack developer freelancer24/7 support for freelancersWebinars, resources, and a Slack workspace to help build your full stack development freelance businessA dedicated internal team who is here to support you and help you succeed!4 more items(s)More job highlightsJob descriptionFreelance as a Full Stack Developer and Work from Home With FreeUpHi! We're FreeUp!FreeUp is a freelance marketplace dedicated to connecting business owners with talented freelancers and remote workers from all over the world.We believe that freelancing is the future of business, and we're building the best community for freelancers possible.Want to learn more about FreeUp? Check out our w...ebsite here, our Glassdoor reviews here, or read this feature in the LA Times about how we're the freelance platform everyone wants to be part of.About Freelancing as a Full Stack Developer With FreeUp:• Daily Full Stack Developer job opportunities• Set your own hourly full stack developer freelance rates (or fixed-rate projects)• Set your own work from home schedule• Work and earn as much as you want as a full stack developer freelancer• 24/7 support for freelancers• Webinars, resources, and a Slack workspace to help build your full stack development freelance business• A dedicated internal team who is here to support you and help you succeed!Remote Full Stack Developer Requirements:• Proven experience as a Full Stack Developer or similar role• Proven experience developing desktop and mobile applications• Familiarity with common stacks• Knowledge of multiple front-end languages and libraries (such as HTML/ CSS, JavaScript, XML, jQuery, etc. etc.)• Knowledge of multiple back-end languages (such as C#, Java, Python, etc. etc.) and JavaScript frameworks (such as Angular, React, Node.js, etc. etc.)• Familiarity with databases (e.g. MySQL, MongoDB), web servers (e.g. Apache) and UI/UX design• Excellent communication and teamwork skills - you must respond to clients within a business day!How to Apply to Be a FreeUp Freelancer• Write a short cover letter about why you're a great full stack developer freelancer• We'll reach out for your resume with some follow upquestions• Quick Zoom video interview with a member of theFreeUp team• Once you're in our network, start applying to full stack development freelance jobs and make money!Freelancers located in the state of California will be required to provide an EIN for tax purposes.

3 days per week on-site.Remote Work: Yes.DescriptionGridiron IT is looking to hire a Senior Full-Stack Developer to support a government program. The candidate will... be working with client leadership, and the existing team, to develop a long-term plan for the application and should have management and communication skills as well as experience with full-stack development including .Net and Angular. The ideal candidate will be able to take ownership of the codebase, delegate tasks to existing team members, and provide recommendations to stakeholders.ResponsibilitiesConduct Code-Reviews and manage version control for the existing teamDesign and develop new front-end features and improvements to existing featuresDesign and develop new APIs and improvements to existing APIsPerform regular updates of Angular and DotnetWork across teams to optimize performance and security of the applicationWork across multiple teams to simplify the existing database designWork across multiple teams to ensure monitoring metrics and testing is adequateAssist with creating a long-term modernization plan for the applicationWork and report within an Agile FrameworkQualificationsBachelor’s Degree (in Computer Science or similar)5+ years of development experience (or Master’s and 3+ years)Previous work experience with .Net and Node DevelopmentProven understanding of frontend development: i.e. Angular, AngularJS, React, VueProven understanding of version control and deployment pipelines: i.e. Git, GitLab, GitHub, Git Actions, SVNClear written and verbal communications skills (English)Excellent communication, critical thinking and problem-solvingOnsite presence 3 days per weekClearanceApplicants selected will be subject to a security investigation and may need to meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information.Compensation and BenefitsSalary Range: $50-62 hourly (Compensation is determined by various factors, including but not limited to location, work experience, skills, education, certifications, seniority, and business needs. This range may be modified in the future.)Benefits: Gridiron offers a comprehensive benefits package including medical, dental, vision insurance, HSA, FSA, 401(k), disability & ADD insurance, life and pet insurance to eligible employees. Full-time and part-time employees working at least 30 hours per week on a regular basis are eligible to participate in Gridiron’s benefits programs.Gridiron IT Solutions is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status or disability status.Gridiron IT is a Women Owned Small Business (WOSB) headquartered in the Washington, D.C. area that supports our clients' missions throughout the United States. Gridiron IT specializes in providing comprehensive IT services tailored to meet the needs of federal agencies. Our capabilities include IT Infrastructure & Cloud Services, Cyber Security, Software Integration & Development, Data Solution & AI, and Enterprise Applications. These capabilities are backed by Gridiron IT's experienced workforce and our commitment to ensuring we meet and exceed our clients' expectations.

Job highlightsIdentified by Google from the original job postQualificationsThe ideal candidate should have a strong understanding of web technologies, excellent problem-solving skills, and the ability to work collaboratively in a fast-paced environment*All candidates must have an active Secret clearanceActive Secret (S) clearanceMust be able to obtain TS/SCI clearanceMust be able to obtain DHS Suitability6+ years of applicable experience and a Bachelor's degreeBachelor's degree in Software Engineering, Computer Science, Information Systems or a related discipline is requiredTwo year of related work experience may be substituted for each year of degree level of educationActive and transferable Active U.S. government issued security clearance is required prior to start date6 more items(s)ResponsibilitiesAs a Full Stack Developer, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining both front-end and back-end systemssupporting the ART as a SAFe Product Owner (Cyber) to support the design, development, and deployment of advanced cybersecurity capabilitiesProficient in Python and JavaScriptFrameworks (Angular, Django, Alation Data IntelligenceConfiguration Management and Version ControlUse version control systems (e.g., Git) to manage code repositoriesCollaborate with cross-functional teams, including designers, product managers, and other developersExperience with Elastic Cloud Enterprise, AWS RedshiftCI/CD, deployment, and DevOpsWork with deployment tools and automation processes to streamline deployment pipelinesCollaborate with DevOps teams to optimize the development and deployment workflow8 more items(s)More job highlightsJob descriptionNightwing provides technically advanced full-spectrum cyber, data operations, systems integration and intelligence mission support services to meet our customers' most demanding challenges. Our capabilities include cyber space operations, cyber defense and resiliency, vulnerability research, ubiquitous technical surveillance, data intelligence, lifecycle mission enablement, and software modernizat...ion. Nightwing brings disruptive technologies, agility, and competitive offerings to customers in the intelligence community, defense, civil, and commercial markets.NightWing is supporting a U.S. Government customer on a large mission critical development and sustainment program to design, build, deliver, and operate a network operations environment with new cyber capabilities to address emerging threats. NightWing is seeking a talented and experienced Full Stack Developer to join our dynamic development team. As a Full Stack Developer, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining both front-end and back-end systems. The ideal candidate should have a strong understanding of web technologies, excellent problem-solving skills, and the ability to work collaboratively in a fast-paced environment. supporting the ART as a SAFe Product Owner (Cyber) to support the design, development, and deployment of advanced cybersecurity capabilities.• *All candidates must have an active Secret clearanceResponsibilities Include:• Proficient in Python and JavaScript• Frameworks (Angular, Django, Alation Data Intelligence• Configuration Management and Version Control• Use version control systems (e.g., Git) to manage code repositories• Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including designers, product managers, and other developers• Experience with Elastic Cloud Enterprise, AWS Redshift• CI/CD, deployment, and DevOps• Work with deployment tools and automation processes to streamline deployment pipelines• Collaborate with DevOps teams to optimize the development and deployment workflowRequired Skills:• Active Secret (S) clearance.• Must be able to obtain TS/SCI clearance• Must be able to obtain DHS Suitability• 6+ years of applicable experience and a Bachelor's degreeDesired Skills:• Proven Experience as a Full Stack Developer or similar role.• Familiarity with Agile/Scrum development methodologies• Strong proficiency in front-end technologies (HTML,CSS, JavaScript) and modern Java Script frameworks• Experience with server-side language (Node.js, Python Ruby, Java) and server-side frameworks• Familiarity with databases (SQL and NoSQL), database design, and optimization• Knowledge of RESTful API development and integration• Understanding of web application security best practices.• Excellent problem-solving and communication skillsRequired Education:Bachelor's degree in Software Engineering, Computer Science, Information Systems or a related discipline is required. Two year of related work experience may be substituted for each year of degree level of education.Desired Certifications:- One or more of the following certifications in good, current standing: CISA, GCIH, GCED, CISSP, CASP, or Security+- AWS certifications such as Cloud DevOps Developer Assoc, SysOps Administrator Assoc, Advanced Networking Spec, Security Spec.Active and transferable Active U.S. government issued security clearance is required prior to start date.Syndeo #: 3347Previously part of a leading Fortune 100 company and headquartered in Dulles, VA; Nightwing became independent in 2024 but continues to support the nation's most mission impactful initiatives. When we formed Nightwing, we brought a deep set of credentials and an unfaltering commitment to the mission. For over four decades, our team has been providing some of the world's most technically advanced full-spectrum cyber, data operations, systems integration and intelligence support services to the U.S. government on its most important missions.At Nightwing, we value collaboration and teamwork. You'll have the opportunity to work alongside talented individuals who are passionate about what they do. Together, we'll leverage our collective expertise to drive innovation, solve complex problems, and deliver exceptional results for our clients.Thank you for considering joining us as we embark on this new journey and shape the future of cybersecurity and intelligence together as part of the Nightwing team.At Nightwing, we value collaboration and teamwork. You'll have the opportunity to work alongside talented individuals who are passionate about what they do. Together, we'll leverage our collective expertise to drive innovation, solve complex problems, and deliver exceptional results for our clients.Thank you for considering joining us as we embark on this new journey and shape the future of cybersecurity and intelligence together as part of the Nightwing team.Nightwing is An Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status, age or any other federally protected class.

job_title: Remote Senior Java/API Full-stack Developer | WFH
job_description: Job descriptionWe are the champions of childhoodHanna Andersson is a Portland, Oregon-based premier kids and baby clothing brand. Our clothes are made to play, made to last, and designed to let kids be kids. We have core commitments to design, quality, and sustainability, and we believe in helping families create meaningful everyday moments. These principles guide the Hanna Way, and lead to an experience authe...ntically different from other children’s brands.We cultivate our unique brand by hiring team members who believe in these values, own a customer service mindset, and who are innovative, results-oriented, and comfortable working in a collaborative and growth-driven work environment. We all share in our brand’s success, and we actively encourage our team members to maintain a healthy balance in their daily lives.The Full Stack Software Developer supports the development team by contributing to both front-end web and back-end development projects and learning advanced development practices. This role focuses on technical capabilities, skill enhancement, and taking on more responsibility in project execution.Minimum qualifications• Bachelor’s degree in computer science or equivalent practical experience.• 5+ years of experience with software development in one or more programming languages (e.g., JavaScript, Python, C#, C++, Java).• 5+ year of experience with data structures/algorithms, testing, maintaining, and launching software products.Preferred qualifications• 4+ years of experience in front-end web development, preferably in e-commerce.• 4+ years building and working on back-end API’s, preferably in e-commerce.• Experience developing cloud services on AWS, Azure or GCP.• Proficiency in HTML, CSS, and JavaScript and relevant related frameworks.• Familiarity with Agile/Scrum methodologies.• Experience working in an environment utilizing tools like Git and Jira.• Excellent communication and teamwork abilities with positive morale.• Strong problem-solving skills.• Experience with Next JS and React is highly preferred.Responsibilities• Implement solutions considering performance, scalability, and security under guidance from more senior developers.• Develop, unit test, and maintain front-end components, ensuring high-quality and responsive designs.• Develop, unit test, and maintain back-end services, ensuring high-quality and high-performance designs.• Collaborate with team members using agile software development techniques to build quality solutions within expected timelines.• Participate in design reviews and code
